ðŸ”¥ waha | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating WhatsApp interactions through a REST API.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ WhatsApp HTTP API (REST API) â€¢ Configurable in one click â€¢ Multiple engines: WEBJS, NOWEB, GOWS â€¢ Docker support â€¢ Swagger documentation
ðŸ“– Summary: WAHA is a WhatsApp HTTP API that allows developers to automate WhatsApp interactions using a REST API. It offers multiple engines and can be easily configured and deployed using Docker. The API provides functionalities such as sending text messages and retrieving screenshots of the WhatsApp instance.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ zuse | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Terminal-based IRC client for distraction-free chatting.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Sleek, minimal terminal IRC client â€¢ Built with Go and Bubble Tea framework â€¢ Keybindings for scrolling chat and switching panes
ðŸ“– Summary: ZUSE is a terminal-based IRC client built with Go and the Bubble Tea framework. It provides a clean and minimal interface for chatting on IRC channels directly from the terminal. Key features include keybindings for navigation and a distraction-free environment.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ duckstation | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Emulating PlayStation 1 games on various platforms.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ PlayStation 1 emulation â€¢ CPU Recompiler/JIT (x86-64, armv7/AArch32, AArch64, RISC-V/RV64) â€¢ Hardware renderers (D3D11, D3D12, OpenGL, Vulkan, Metal) â€¢ Upscaling and texture filtering â€¢ Save state support
ðŸ“– Summary: DuckStation is a PlayStation 1 emulator focused on playability, speed, and accuracy. It supports multiple platforms and rendering APIs, offering enhancements like upscaling and texture filtering. The emulator aims to provide a user-friendly experience with features like save states and broad controller support.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ klavis | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Open source MCP integration for AI applications, providing hosted, secure MCP servers and eliminating auth management and client-side code.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Instant Integration with Python and TypeScript SDKs or REST API â€¢ Built-in Authentication with Secure OAuth flows and API key management â€¢ Production-Ready hosted infrastructure
ðŸ“– Summary: Klavis AI offers open-source MCP integrations for AI applications, providing a hosted and secure MCP server solution. It simplifies integration with features like built-in authentication, SDKs for Python and TypeScript, and access to numerous tools. Klavis AI is compatible with various LLMs and AI agent frameworks and can also be self-hosted.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ mordant | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Rendering styled text in command-line applications.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Colorful ANSI output with terminal capability detection â€¢ Markdown rendering to the terminal â€¢ Widgets for terminal output layout (lists, tables, panels) â€¢ Animation support for widgets (progress bars, dashboards)
ðŸ“– Summary: Mordant is a Kotlin library designed for creating visually appealing command-line applications. It allows developers to easily add color and style to text, render Markdown, create layouts with widgets like tables and lists, and even animate these widgets. Mordant simplifies the process of enhancing the user experience in terminal-based applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ PcapPlusPlus | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Capturing, parsing, and crafting network packets in C++ applications across multiple platforms.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Capturing network packets â€¢ Parsing network packets â€¢ Crafting network packets â€¢ Multiplatform support
ðŸ“– Summary: PcapPlusPlus is a multiplatform C++ library designed for efficient capturing, parsing, and crafting of network packets. It provides C++ wrappers for popular packet processing engines like libpcap, WinPcap, Npcap, DPDK, AF_XDP and PF_RING. It supports decoding and forging capabilities for a large variety of network protocols and can be downloaded via GitHub, Homebrew, Vcpkg, Conan or built manually.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ mydumper | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating consistent and efficient logical backups of MySQL databases.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Parallelism for faster backups â€¢ Consistent snapshots across all threads â€¢ PCRE support for database and table inclusion/exclusion â€¢ Separate files for tables and metadata
ðŸ“– Summary: MyDumper is a tool for creating logical backups of MySQL databases. It utilizes multithreading to achieve faster backup speeds and provides consistent snapshots. It also offers features like PCRE support for specifying database and table inclusions/exclusions and separate files for tables and metadata, making it easier to manage backups.
